Name.BusinessNameLine1: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS OF PORTLAND METROPOLITAN AREA

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE TO REACH THEIR POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO ENABLE ALL YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO NEED US MOST, TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS PRODUCTIVE, CARING, AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS.
IRS990.Description: THE CLUBS OFFER YOUNG PEOPLE ADULTS WHO RESPECT AND LISTEN TO THEM; A SAFE ENVIRONMENT WHERE THEY CAN HAVE FUN AND BE THEMSELVES; AND INTERESTING CONTRUCTIVE ACTIVITIES THAT CHANNEL YOUTHFUL ENERGY INTO CREATIVE AND CHALLENGING PURSUITS. CLUB PROGRAMS FOSTER A SENSE OF BELONGING, COMPETENCE, USEFULNESS, POWER AND INFLUENCE OVER THEIR LIFE AND THEIR ENVIRONMENT THAT BUILDS CONFIDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM. MORE THAN 20,000 KIDS, AGES 6-18, ARE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE PROGRAMS, ACTIVITIES, AND SERVICES PROVIDED BY BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS OF PORTLAND IN THE FOLLOWING CORE AREAS:1) CHARACTER AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT2) EDUCATION AND CAREER DEVELOPMENT3) HEALTH AND LIFE SKILLS4) THE ARTS5) SPORTS, FITNESS AND RECREATION

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS OF PORTLAND METROPOLITAN AREA, INC.S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR LONGTERM SUPPORT OF THE ORGANIZATION. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. AS REQUIRED BY U.S. GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (GAAP), NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH ENDOWMENT FUNDS, INCLUDING FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS, ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSENCE OF DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS OR BOARD DESIGNATIONS. IN ACCORDANCE WITH UPMIFA, THE ORGANIZATION CONSIDERS THE FOLLOWING FACTORS IN MAKING A DETERMINATION TO APPROPRIATE OR ACCUMULATE DONORRESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS: (1) THE DURATION AND PRESERVATION OF THE FUND (2) THE PURPOSES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND THE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUND (3) GENERAL ECONOMIC CONDITIONS (4) THE POSSIBLE EFFECT OF INFLATION AND DEFLATION (5) THE EXPECTED TOTAL RETURN FROM INCOME AND THE APPRECIATION OF INVESTMENTS (6) OTHER RESOURCES OF THE ORGANIZATION (7) THE INVESTMENT POLICIES OF THE ORGANIZATION

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE NUMBER OF THE CONTRIBUTIONS IS THE SAME AS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: JOSEPH MARZIELLO AND LISABETH MARZIELLO, CO-CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, ARE HUSBAND AND WIFE. MATT STASHIN AND MELISSA STASHIN, WHO SHARE A BOARD MEMBER POSITION, ARE HUSBAND AND WIFE. JOEL GRAYSON AND PAULA MCCULLOUGH, WHO ARE BOARD MEMBERS, ARE HUSBAND AND WIFE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WILL BE REVIEWED AT A MEETING CONDUCTED BY THE AUDITOR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CEO SENDS A LETTER TO EACH BOARD MEMBER AND OFFICER A LETTER INQUIRING WHETHER THEY ARE INVOLVED IN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SITUATION. BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS MUST PROMPTLY REPORT IN WRITING TO THE CEO ANY PRESENT OR FUTURE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION LEVELS AND AND POLICIES ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR COMPARABILITY WITH OTHER EQUIVALENT POSITIONS IN THE REGION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ALL MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, FINANCE, & OTHER COMMITTEES ARE MAINLY COMPRISED OF THE GOVERNING BODY WITH A FEW MEMBERS NOT OF THE GOVERNING BODY.
